summary: This mod adds craftable Netch Leather armor to Skyrim, a type of armor which saw its original appearance in The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/FNchgSu.png[/img][/center]
[size=3]This mod adds craftable 'Netch Leather' armor to Skyrim, a type of armor which saw its first and (until now) only appearance in [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Morrowind:Netch_Leather_%28style%29]The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind[/url].
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/4wuMPUi.png[/img][/center]
Netch Leather armor was traditionally an exclusive craft of the Dunmer of Morrowind and Solstheim; they used Netch Leather because on Morrowind it was much more plentiful than ordinary leather, and the armor itself is designed not only to protect the wearer during combat but also provide comfort and protection from the elements.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/24N0Miw.png[/img][/center]
This mod adds an entire set of balanced, lore-friendly light armor, including several variations of helmets, cuirass, bracers, boots + shield, and more protective Netch Boiled Leather helmets + cuirass.

Netch Leather armor offers slightly more protection than standard leather armor and is also lighter, and Netch Boiled Leather armor offers protection equal to Elven armor.

Netch Leather armor is fully compatible with all races, sexes and standard body types.

The helmets show long hair at the back, and the gauntlets show claws on beast-race hands.

The helmets also come in 4 varieties;
1) full helmet - the head is covered by the helmet, and the face is covered by the mask & goggles.
2) open helmet - the head is covered by the helmet, but the face is exposed with the goggles resting on the forehead and the mask pulled down under the chin.
3) half helmet - the helmet covers the head but there are no goggles or mask.
4) face cover - only the goggles & mask without a helmet, can be combined with other helmets that do not cover the face.

Circlets can be worn over all styles of helmet.

The helmets with goggles & mask worn over the face offer protection from ash storms in [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31968]Wet & Cold - Ashes[/url].

A few named Dunmer NPCs and occasionally Dunmer bandits in Solstheim can be seen wearing Netch Leather armor.

Netch Leather armor uses Standard Definition textures.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/zoQd6by.png[/img][/center]
This mod requires Skyrim v1.9 and the Dragonborn DLC.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/moXilT4.png[/img][/center]
You can craft Netch Leather armor at any Forge, and the recipes can be found under the 'Leather' category; crafting regular Netch Leather armor requires the 'Steel Smithing' perk, and to craft Netch Boiled Leather armor you need to have the Elven Smithing perk.

Netch Leather armor requires Netch Leather and Netch Leather Strips to create, and Netch Leather to improve at the Workbench. Helmets with goggles require a Chitin Plate, and the shield requires an Iron Ingot.

Netch Leather can be obtained on the isle of Solstheim, where it is sold by blacksmiths and traders, and can also be harvested from the corpses of slain Netch.

Netch Leather is also sold on the Skyrim mainland by 2 merchants; Revyn Sadri of 'Sadri's Used Wares' in Windhelm, and Brand-Shei from the Riften marketplace. Both these merchants sell all the materials required to craft Netch Leather armor, and will stock the armor from level 10+.

Netch Leather Strips can be crafted at the Tanning Rack from Netch Leather.

Netch Boiled Leather armor requires Netch Boiled Leather and Netch Leather Strips to create, and Netch Boiled Leather to improve at the Workbench.

Netch Boiled Leather can be crafted at Cooking Pots from Netch Leather and Netch Jelly.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/ouFvYFV.png[/img][/center]
HeirOfTheSeptem's Retexture: Alternate texture pack provided by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/7148503]HeirOfTheSeptem[/url].

Helmets Only: This is a standalone version of the mod which only contains crafting recipes for the helmets, no other armor or features.

Boring Version: Contains only crafting recipes for the armor, no other features.

Digitigrade Feet for Khajiit & Argonians: Compatibility files for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43833]Digitigrade Khajiit[/url] & [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19283]Argonian Raptor Feet[/url] by [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/582915]artifex0[/url]. I recommend running this with the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50637]True Digitigrade Beast Races[/url] skeleton replacer.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/tEcDh4T.png[/img][/center]
v.1.2: Added more helmet variants, revised smithing requirements, improved several textures and meshes, added to select merchant lists in Skyrim, enabled helmets to have circlets worn over them, improved fit of facemasks to male orcs. Released simultaneously with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/7148503]HeirOfTheSeptem[/url]'s retexture, and standalone helmet-only optional files.

v1.1: Fixed a bug with the male armor not displaying correctly, added compatibility to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31968]Wet & Cold[/url], added Netch Leather armors to a few Dunmer NPCs and bandit outfit lists.

v1.0: Initial upload.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/XUk7fk0.png[/img][/center]
Some areas of the armor may not accurately display blood splatters or snow/ash powder.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/QaRejtZ.png[/img][/center]
Over the next several weeks I plan to create and release several more Morrowind-themed armor sets not previously seen in the Dragonborn DLC or my Morrowind Armor Compilation.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Tsx5QD9.png[/img][/center]
[b][i]Will you be adapting this armor mod to UNP/CBBE/etc. body types?[/i][/b]
I have no plans to, however if someone else wants to, I will be happy to include their work in this mod page as an optional file.

[b][i]Can I use your mod to create a mod of my own?[/i][/b]
You are welcome to use any of the assets from this mod except the ones in the helmet; if you want to use those you require permission from other mod authors, see in the 'Credits' section below. For my mod assets, you dont need to ask my permission, just drop me a note to say that you have and link to your mod page, also giving credit is appreciated.

[b][i]Can I make a translation of this mod, or release mod compatibility files?[/i][/b]
Yes you may.

[b][i]Can I upload screenshots showing my characters using your armor?[/i][/b]
Yes please! I would particularly like to see screenshots showing off fancy ENB rendering and lighting effects.


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/BgHQuf1.png[/img][/center]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3147615]Volvaga0[/url]: Thanks to Volvaga0 for letting me use his [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20900]Bandanas of Skyrim[/url], [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33177]Chitin Goggles[/url] and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/33391]Face Masks of Skyrim[/url] meshes.
Credit also goes to Volvaga0 for inspiring me with his mod page design and layout.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/3575696]Brokefoot[/url]: Thanks to Brokefoot for letting me use the 'respirator' mesh from his [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31813]West Wind Combat Series - Assault Armor[/url] mod.

Fonts: I use the 'Planewalker' font for the headings on this page, from [url=http://www.myrrlyn.com/fonts.html][Here][/url].

Inspiration: The artwork of Michael Kirkbride, a concept artist and writer who worked on Morrowind and several other Elder Scrolls titles, who to this day continues to produce awesome fan works set in TES. [url=http://michaelkirkbride.tumblr.com][Link to his Tumblr][/url], [url=http://www.reddit.com/user/MKirkbride][Link to his Reddit account][/url].


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Mn7Tk9d.png[/img][/center]
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=223298980]Morrowind Amor: Netch Leather[/url] on Steam Workshop.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51039]Morrowind Amor: Netch Leather FR Traduction[/url] (French translation).

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22793]Morrowind Armor Compilation[/url]: My original armor mod which added several types of armor unique to Morrowind into Skyrim, created well before the Dragonborn DLC was announced.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32226]Teh-Husky Mod Compilation[/url]: A compilation of my most popular older mods, mostly armor mods.[/size]
author: Teh-Husky
